results.content: repetitives tdd tests, no new cases,

response.content:
Hi Hamza,
I have covered almost all scenarios for Redux(action, reducer testcases) and for React side (Loading, error, data testing and also covered testcases for Formik Form validation)
Spring boot Side:- Unit testing for Repository, service, controller and also covered Integration testing. 

What else you need?. Pease let me know.

Thanks

results.content: So far so good. I am really interested in how to use Travis and Heroku to interact with server side and client side repos... there were still a few git tricks I had to apply to get everything wired up for Travis and Heroku but I can imagine that is a pretty fluid workflow as I know they have undergone quite a bit of recent changes. Really excited to get going in this course.

results.content: Course is really good. The material covered is very useful and delivered with precision from a pragmatic perspective. The instructor is very responsive in answering problems you have during the course, usually replying within few hours after you post a question, with valuable answers. Only advices to make it even better are: share the code of the course on a Github repo, include some links to follow up on few topics, include slides for most important take away topics, provide deep dive references picked by quality to read more on some of the topics. Thanks for the really good course.
results.content_html: Course is really good. The material covered is very useful and delivered with precision from a pragmatic perspective. The instructor is very responsive in answering problems you have during the course, usually replying within few hours after you post a question, with valuable answers. Only advices to make it even better are: share the code of the course on a Github repo, include some links to follow up on few topics, include slides for most important take away topics, provide deep dive references picked by quality to read more on some of the topics. response.content:
Hi Kim, 
I can understand your concern (its diversity :)). I will suggest you to enable CC and also never hesitate to ask question on QA section. I will try my best to answer your questions.
My suggestion would be that you should complete the course as it will help you to develop essential skills like TDD, CI/CD, Unit testing, e2e integration for both react and java
